snippet: The division of Timken, a family-controlled company, into separate companies making bearings and steel has brought anxiety to its Ohio hometown.
abstract: Wall Street's successful push to split family-controlled steel company Timken into two entities has brought deep anxiety to Canton, Ohio, where employees now fear company's exposure to takeover; Relational Investors used data analytics to determine that Timken shares would fetch more if company were divided, and it quietly bought up shares until it was in a position to drum up support for split; case offers insight into nuanced world of modern shareholder activism.
lead_paragraph: The division of Timken, a family-controlled company, into separate companies making bearings and steel has brought anxiety to its Ohio hometown.

headline.seo: Timken Bows to Activist Investors, and Splits in Two
